greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-1) * f(-q^3, -q^4)^3 / (f(-q^1, -q^6)^2 * f(-q^2, -q^5)) in powers of q where f() is Ramanujan's two-variable theta function.
comment: A generator (Hauptmodul) of the function field associated with the congruence subgroup Gamma_1(7).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: G.f. A(q) satisfies 0 = f(A(q), A(q^2)) where f(u, v) = (u^2 + v) * (u*v^2 + v^2 - 1) - 2*v * (u + 1) * (v^2 + 2*u*v + v + 3*u).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 1/q (QPochhammer[ q^3, q^7] QPochhammer[ q^4, q^7])^3 / (QPochhammer[ q^1, q^7]^2 QPochhammer[ q^2, q^7] QPochhammer[ q^5, q^7] QPochhammer[ q^6, q^7]^2), {q, 0, n}];
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 02 2014
